definition: full-time care (of children in a boarding nursery)
prop/support (for weight)/rest (e.g. arm rest)/thanks to/to hold in one's hand/to support in one's palm/to give/to base/to commit/to set/torr (unit of pressure)
to trust/to entrust/to be entrusted with/to act as trustee

sentences.english: Now, more than 60 percent of kindergarteners attend for a full day.
sentences.chinese: 而现在，超过百分之六十的幼儿参加了全托。

sentences.english: An old, in a special boarding school four grades, each week home again.
sentences.chinese: 一岁，在特殊全托学校读四年级，每星期接回家一次。

sentences.english: More Children Are Attending Full-Day Kindergarten.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的宝贝得到全托幼儿园的照顾。

sentences.english: In 1983, just under one-third of kindergarteners went to school.
sentences.chinese: 在1983年，不到三分之一的孩子去了全托幼儿园。

definition: to attend to the needs of (an invalid, disabled person etc)/caregiver
to place in the care of sb (a child, pet etc)/to foster/to board out
working couple (husband and wife both employed)
to tend/to take care of sb
to foster/to provide care (esp. for the elderly)
to attend school as a day student
